data: We stand on the loftiest peak of the Big Wind River Mountains, that highest and longest chain of the Northern Rockies, a chaos of granite fifteen thousand feet towards the firmament from the sea.
Big Wind River Mountains | Northern Rockies
loftiest peak of the Big Wind River Mountains
The Red River Half-Breed: A Tale of the Wild North-West
Aimard, Gustave, 1818-1883; St. John, Percy B. (Percy Bolingbroke), 1821-1889 [Editor]; Williams, Henry Llewellyn, 1842- [Translator]
